notes.text:
Updated man packages fixing a local GID man exploit and a 
potential GID man to root exploit, as well as a problem with the 
man paths of Red Hat Linux 5.x and 6.x.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Users could gain access to the GID man by overrunning a buffer in the 
ultimate_source() function.

Users with GID man could get root access by creating man pages with 
filenames containing escape characters.

Furthermore, the previous errata package hardcoded Red Hat Linux 7.x man 
paths even on Red Hat Linux 5.x and 6.x.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: : Updated man package fixing GID security problems.

notes.text: Buffer overflow in ultimate_source function of man 1.5 and earlier allows local users to gain privileges.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

To update all RPMs for your particular architecture, run:

rpm -Fvh [filenames]

where [filenames] is a list of the RPMs you wish to upgrade.  Only those
RPMs which are currently installed will be updated.  Those RPMs which are
not installed but included in the list will not be updated.  Note that you
can also use wildcards (*.rpm) if your current directory *only* contains
the
desired RPMs.

Please note that this update is also available via Red Hat Network.  Many
people find this an easier way to apply updates.  To use Red Hat Network,
launch the Red Hat Update Agent with the following command:

up2date

This will start an interactive process that will result in the appropriate
RPMs being upgraded on your system.

notes.text: Zope before 2.2.4 allows partially trusted users to bypass security controls for certain methods by accessing the methods through the fmt attribute of dtml-var tags.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
